I should include failures in my CV

This, however, was pure skill. “Luck is when opportunity meets preparation.” Kind of. Success was when the amazing blind luck [of Lee passing away after they did their interviews] combined with their hard, successful, timely work [of creating all the merchandise and selling it to fans] and decent marketing
However, he was right in this case here. He figured out that he owned the rights, so he made far more money than he would have otherwise
So they really did get lucky. Everything else he says is secondary, but, the main thing is that he got lucky to make the right book right before Lee died
“Self-imposed misery is a kind of madness. The cure is to get out”
But this goes against what he was saying earlier about how ownership is important. Or did I miss what he was saying and he just said to sell it as soon as possible when you’re ready to sell

NTS: religions do really rival multinational corporations, not just in terms of assets, but also we have the tried and true “here’s a free psalm/Bible/etc.” method attributed to drug cartels these days. And they have salesmen known as missionaries.
Where? Where can you see how bishops, archbishops, and higher ups (does this mean the pope?) lived?
#Lesson: keep my phone on silent, so it doesn't squawk in the middle of a meeting (unless, of course, I am the owner); and don't use the phone surreptitiously (Or laptop, like I've done with J)
"I only started to get rich when I began to delegate, and to ease up on my work schedule.”

Mexican shootout: each of you bids for the entire company, and promises to buy the company if their bid beats everyone else's. If you're on minority shareholder, it's good for you; if you're a majority shareholder, it's bad for you
"A partnership is *not* a marriage. In a marriage, you should be willing to die for your partner; to share everything; to kill for them if you have to."
“there were no recriminations." This means that it doesn't hurt to ask. While he's going on and on about not giving away your share,
Please think about this if you want to get rich: "ownership is not the most important thing. It is*the only* thing that counts."
To become rich, every single percentage point of everything you own is worth fighting for tooth and claw
To become rich, you must be an owner. You must own it all
"This ‘getting rich’ malarkey is just a game"
Highlight. Startup cashflow rules.
A big part of this book is to help you figure out whether you truly want to be rich. Because if you don't, a modicum of, contentment is better. Health is definitely far more important than wealth
"Assumption is the mother of all fuck ups"

Possible luck-based way of becoming rich: learn VVG’s path through Europe + learn how he signed his paintings + follow the path and see if you can buy a few of these paintings for a hundred dollars apiece. If just one turns out to be authentic, that’s a multimillion-dollar windfall
Suggested #Book: Letters to my Brother by Vincent Van Gogh
“but the losing streaks always seem to become longer, and the winning streaks, shorter” this is the same thing Mom was trying to tell me

When you were talking about Etra Catholic,, except when it comes to to adventure capitalist should be home a little respect, except can you show me anything but uncleWhen you were talking about your campus, you should be humble and almost all respect. Except when it comes to her to a venture capitalist, you should be humble, and I respect, except when it comes to money, can you show me anything but humble, those things, exaggerating, etc. Call staying Anna exaggerating, etc. Close posting, exaggerating, etc.those things, exaggerating, etc. and post, hosting, exaggerating, etc.

If you take venture money, which he calls venture capitalists dolphins, make sure you can get the best legal representation money can buy. Because one little phrase might completely screw you later down the line. They might make you 1 million if you have hundred million dollar idea, but there is I like that they will take more than what they will give.

Lol. How wrong he was, looking at the behemoth Apple has become now. Specifically because of people like him, who, while he may have been terrible at guessing, have a lot of money and like Apple’s products.

“Whoever controls a business, even by a pitiful one percent, is likely to take a great deal of more money out of it than the minority shareholders“ case in point: Volodya Володя keeps control of his Macroaxis idea, and he gets hundreds of thousands in profit. The people who helped him build it? They get thousands in profit.

People who don’t believe you when you congratulate them, are the ones you promote most and the fastest.

This means that, if I want to succeed and get the best basis for striking out on my own, or having a higher capital base, but I should not make it seem as though I believe the manager and the CEO when he says that I am doing a great job. he should understand that I don’t completely believe it, and so he should keep on promoting me. And this means my pay will be higher and higher.
I think Dad’s finally past this point.
“If you want to be rich, you are not looking for a career, except as a launchpad, or as a way to infiltrate and understand a particular industry.“
See, he says it the right way. “IF you shy away for any reason whatsoever, THEN you will never get started, AND THEREFORE you will never get rich.“
“I am convinced that fear of feeling in the eyes of the world is the single biggest impediment to amassing wealth”

Tennis wrote this so many years ago, but it's still rings true. And a big part of Apple success nowadays is from his use of this system. Because all Apple products have such Great support for one another and such an ecosystem, Apple is super successful.
Never stop searching for your luck. You’re searching for an opportunity, and you’re keeping your skills fresh.
“The division of spoils comes only when there are spoils to divide”
Ownership is power
Dad’s no longer got that in his heart. He truly wants me to succeed, inside and out
Fear of failing is the single biggest obstacle to getting rich. On another note: I just passed R Zarchi on a Tesla. You can't tell me that he wouldn't have preferred to see me in a gray jacket
I've already figured this out. A while ago. That I "know," but I don't “do.”
Literally every single thing Dad says. He’s stepped back, though, dialing back his criticisms. Probably because I’ve shown him these books where the authors mention the naysayers and what they say
"making money is a drug not the money and sell, but the making of it."
He (Hawking) also has institutional backing by the time he wrote the book and made the fortune. So he had massive assistance overcoming the disability and illness

Always sue the person responsible for making you sick. Exactly the opposite of what we did when we were crashed into by that Porsche. although mom did retain someone to settle. I should’ve just gotten all the medical attention that I needed then, and sued them to recuperate the losses (and the emotional damage).

After saying, that “your youth and stamina are ebbing away,“ he doesn’t go on to say that the main problem is that you are getting too *old,* rather, he goes on to say “you are getting too *comfortable.*“

These are important tools (he just listed them). That self-confidence is what I lacked, that my parents didn’t give me, but I have it now, so there should be nothing stopping me. I have nothing to prove
He wrote some sort of magazines that were super small and charged the same amount as regular magazines. Easy millions. Then he also wrote about this PC fad and sold more
I want to bookmark apart earlier in the book aware he says how hard you should work, where it makes your lovers work for you, your friends hate you, and your enemies envy you, or something like that
“If I had to get my hands on that [100,000,000 pounds] I would borrow the money and then sell offices to pay off the debt“
I learned this confidence (of course, I only know it in theory and still act poor and have a victim mentality in my daily life—hence I don’t have any real, successful or failed, businesses)

Like Ford said, why learn all of it when you can have someone, an expert, at the push of a button
Also, rich people always have a certain amount of debt. Apparently, it helps reduce taxes.

“If it flies, floats, or fornicates, always rent it. It’s cheaper in the long run.” Pay for prostitutes rather than obtaining for yourself a wife, and rent jets and boats, since maintenance costs are so low.
"I got rich my way, you could even say the old-fashioned way, I am making lots and lots of mistakes." This book is like the book by Paul and Moynihan, concerning the mistakes
Knowledge, learned the hard way, combined with avoidance of error whenever and wherever possible, is the basis for success in any endeavor
The first step? Just do it, and Bluff your way through it just do it, and Bluff your way through it. I wish I had known that at the time
